title: Lesson 72
paragraph: This lesson focuses on deception and manipulation, including deceitful, cunning, and duplicitous behavior.

words.example: He gave a deceitful account of what happened.

words.meaning: given to or involved in conspiring to do something immoral or illegal
words.example: The conniving official was caught embezzling funds.

words.meaning: deceitful in speech or conduct; two-faced
words.example: Her duplicitous behavior fooled many colleagues.

words.meaning: giving an appearance or impression different from the true one
words.japaneseMeaning: 誤解を招く、騙すような

words.meaning: having or showing skill in achieving one’s ends by deceit or evasion
words.example: The fox is known for being cunning.

words.meaning: guilty of or involving betrayal or deception
words.example: He felt betrayed by his treacherous friend.

words.meaning: proceeding in a gradual, subtle way but with harmful effects
words.japaneseMeaning: 陰険な、徐々に害を及ぼす
words.example: The disease has an insidious onset.

words.meaning: given to or involved in making secret plans
words.japaneseMeaning: 策略的な、陰謀を巡らす
words.example: The scheming politician manipulated public opinion.
The witness gave a mendacious statement.

words.meaning: good at influencing other people do what one wants in a clever or unfair way
words.example: She was manipulative in her negotiations.
